intro: Macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-calyx plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its prominent, showy calyx that often persists through flowering and fruiting. The calyx is typically composed of five to seven lobes and may be hairy or smooth depending on the species. Their botanical features make them popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and unique floral structure.
